TF012385-Increasing gender participation
            in Health Nutrition and Population for,TF098264-SPN activities for Niger
            Increase Nutritional Status and Access to Food,TF098265-Niger: Increase Nutritional
            Status and Access to Food Complements for C

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Multi-Sector Demographic
            Project for Niger were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was substantial,
            Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: as one of Niger's top development
            objectives and given its multi-sectoral nature, the
            population agenda should fall under the mandate of the Prime
            Minister who is responsible for managing all ministries
            ensuring full exploitation of comparative advantages to
            contribute to the country's overall development.
            Technical assistance to address the population challenge
            should be clearly devised at all levels of society for
            increased country ownership. Ownership of design by the
            government is a key for successful implementation and impact
            on the ground. The information, education, and,
            communication (IEC) and behavior change communication (BCC)
            campaigns should be linked to the support for women
            empowerment in order to impact on women's economic
            conditions which can reinforce the awareness messages and
            activities in the general population. There is a need for
            specialized IEC and BCC expertise and for the design and
            implementation of interventions to be cognizant of local
            culture, needs, and issues; it points to a need for joint
            design; local delivery with expert oversight, supervision,
            follow-up, and monitoring and evaluation (M and E).
